titles.title: Making further continuing appropriations for the fiscal year 1994, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Appropriations.

Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 282 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 281 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. Providing for the consideration of the joint resolution in the House.
Message on Senate action sent to the House.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 282.

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 281 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit. The joint resolution shall be considered in the House.
DEBATE - Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 282, the House proceeded with one hour of debate on the joint resolution.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
Mr. McDade moved to recommit to Appropriations.
The previous question on the motion to recommit was ordered without objection.
On motion to recommit Failed by voice vote.

vote.text: On passage Passed by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment by Voice Vote.

bill.summary: 10/20/1993--Introduced. Extends the law making further continuing appropriations for FY 1994.
